title: FS: Large 1884 John H. Ryder Cabinet of George Pinkney - Cleveland Blues
author: LEHR

posts.post_title: FS: Large 1884 John H. Ryder Cabinet of George Pinkney - Cleveland Blues
posts.post_content:
For Sale...

This is a beautiful oversized 1884 John H. Ryder cabinet of Cleveland Blues rookie, George Pinkney. The most notable flaws are staining and chipping on the back from album removal, and an approximately 3/4" wrinkle on the bottom boarder. One photo shows a standard size N173 proof cabinet in front of the Pinkney cabinet as a size comparison. You don't see many of this size.

Price: ***(SOLD)***

Payment Accepted: PayPal or Venmo. FF payment preferred but G&S is fine as well.

I can post any other photos needed upon request.
Thanks for looking.

Paul:

That's a beautiful item! 

Good luck with the sale. 

Kevin

[quote name="doug.goodman" post=2506916]May I ask the dimensions?[/QUOTE]

Doug,

It's 10" tall and 6.75" wide. It's the largest 19th century single player cabinet I've ever owned. 

*(Note)* This was claimed via PM last night and is sold pending payment.

Id never heard of this guy but apparently he held the Major League record for consecutive games played on his retirement and also the Major League record for consecutive innings played ….. only broken a century later by Cal Ripken Jr! Pretty cool……. Congratulations to the seller and to the new owner!
What a beautiful cabinet! Congrats to the new owner!
